column1: BBC News NI outlines the latest data on coronavirus and Covid-19 vaccinations across Northern Ireland and the Republic of Ireland.Seven Covid-19-related deaths have been reported in Northern Ireland on Friday.Deaths are measured by recording those who died within 28 days of receiving a positive result in a test for coronavirus.The total number of deaths linked to Covid-19 in Northern Ireland since the start of the pandemic is 2
column3: 690 new cases of coronavirus were reported in Northern Ireland on Friday
column5: 681 on Thursday.That includes cases confirmed from samples taken in recent days
column6: not necessarily just in the latest 24-hour reporting period.There are 410 patients with Covid-19 in hospitals
column7: down from 419 on Thursday.There are 33 patients with Covid-19 in hospital intensive care units
column8: down from 34 on Thursday.Last updated 19 November at 14:00 GMTSource: Department of Health Northern IrelandA total of 2
column10: 873 vaccines for Covid-19 have been administered in Northern Ireland as of Friday.Of those
column19: 336 are boosters.Last updated 19 November at 14:00 GMTSource: Department of Health Northern IrelandAnother 3
column20: 138 cases of coronavirus were reported in the Republic of Ireland on Thursday
column22: 650 on Thursday.The total number of deaths linked to Covid-19 in the Republic of Ireland since the start of the pandemic is 5
column25: is updated weekly and includes "probable and possible" Covid-19-linked deaths.There are 643 patients with Covid-19 in hospitals.There are 118 patients with Covid-19 in hospital intensive care units.Last updated 19 November at 14:00 local timeSource: Department of Health IrelandA total of 7
column27: 732 vaccines for Covid-19 had been administered in the Republic of Ireland as of Tuesday.A total of 3

column33: 422 immunocompromised people have received their third dose.Last updated 18 November at 14:00 local timeSource: Department of Health Ireland
